Dead by Daylight is a very fun take on the "Run from the killer" genre. With an expansive and varying fan base that ranges from people hiding in bushes, to people taking the killer head on for their friends sake or the killer's torment. My personal experiences range from me playing as Mike Myers and Freddy Krueger, people usually either run on the spot or take a minute to laugh at me and have a fun time. On the survivor side I main a survivor called Claudette, she is a healer oriented survivor that always gets joked about for how well she blends into the environment (she's black and the games are dark). I have some good words of advice for starters and people looking into the game. The games on occasion will take an extremely long time to load and it may seem as if it will never load. Just wait, the only downside is that you will have three people. If you get into a really infuriating situation or if you're about to die, don't disconnect. It is very irritating to the people on the opposing side and you will get less point and you run the risk of getting reported and banned. Besides that, this game is some real fun and if you play your cards just right... You might be running out there or making sure no soul goes out alive real easy.
Honestly pretty fun to play with freinds

Dead by Daylight is a 1v4 asymmetrical action game with a horror aesthetic. The game is not very intuitive for new players, consisting of both a barebones out of date tutorial, and an incredible grind of a progression system. That being said, once you know what you're supposed to be doing and have put several hours into the game, the gameplay loop is astounding. The tension during a chase is incredible, whether playing killer or survivor. All in all, I suggest grabbing a couple of friends to play with if you're new because thats where the game shines the most.  It's going to be hard to find another asymmetrical game that is even close to as good as DBD.

It's alright over-all, however it has some terrible balance issues that just seem to get worse and worse with each killer they add. 

For reference I'm a legacy player and have level 50 on all core survivors and killers. There are serious balance issues where some maps are just nearly impossible for killers or some killers that have insane OP abilities compared to the survivors. It's a great game, but only if you are looking for mindless fun. Don't expect too much depth.

Home to an extremely, perhaps unavoidably toxic community--one that, frankly, BHVR does too little to curb. The overall lack of sportsmanship will be enough to (small-r) ruin more than a few matches, and you hope, sometimes in vain, that those matches won't be *too* consecutive. Maybe that sounds like a rough place to start, but you need to know that much right off the bat. It's a crapshoot--but when you finally jump into a good game, you'll be hard-pressed to find a more exciting experience. There's really no other multimedia project that better understands the fundamentals of American horror (and beyond), the concepts and implications that made the famous characters they utilize so terrifying in the first place. Even when you know the game cold, even when you anticipate every meta-perk, every drop and lunge and stab and death, the in-game heartbeat will always match your own. No foolin'--in terms of thought and thrill, DEAD BY DAYLIGHT is essential for anyone with any interest in the modern icons, the classic expressions, the general idea of horror. Take plenty of breaks, jump back in, and remember that sometimes it's okay to displease the Entity.

I have had this game since release and through the years, i have realized that  this game is something i can't get enough of playing. It is repetitive  but so different each time that it keeps me entertained for hours without realizing it. i love and hate the changes that are implemented regularly but it makes me happy to see a team actually striving to make their game better. They listen to the community and overall im glad i found this game when i did.

So... Dead by Daylight, or should I call it more like "Dead by Buglight"?
The bugality Kill your friends is broken just as much my spanish: perks not working, glitch everywhere and a too much lagging p2p mode. What about the key thing of the game: survive and survive with friends the infinity? Those two bugalities are awesome: time tends towards infinity if you're in singlemode or in couple+third wheel... especially if a two-friends team joins in a lobby with a sole player. But, back to the real game; bugs are everywhere, from miracles to invisible men and raining men: in Dead By Daylight all is possible! Even flying through air like nothing!

Now, jokes and bug aside, DBD is a wonderful game, especially if played with friends: it's challenging and fun, with a smorgasbord of killers and survivors to choose from.

But remember: don't bully the poor killer, he's something like a person too! Killers (and Nea) have hearts too!
